abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Social Infrastructure
            Retrofitting Project for Belarus were as follows: outcomes
            were satisfactory, risk to development outcome was
            satisfactory, Bank performance was satisfactory, and
            borrower performance was satisfactory. Some lessons learned
            included: when re-launching an investment program with a
            country, it is key to determine a sector for which the
            Government has sufficient commitment, and the new project
            should have visible economic and social benefits, even in an
            uncertain macroeconomic and structural environment. In order
            to measure the results of the project, it is important to
            have the baseline and end-of-project indicators quantified
            prior to implementation and to have measurable indicators.
            In projects that have many project sites that are widely
            dispersed throughout the country and contracts that are too
            small to be of interest to international bidders, it is
            necessary to provide workshops, and information to local
            bidders; to revise the conditions and terms of the bidding
            documents as needed to attract a sufficient number of bids;
            and for both the Bank team and the Project Management Unit
            (PMU) to meet with potential local bidders to inform them
            about the Bank's procurement procedures and determine
            the reasons for their failure to bid. It is important to
            have accurate basic data for the technical specifications
            and require the beneficiary institution to sign off on the
            data, have the design and supervision consultant and the
            project implementing agency visit the sites before
            finalization of the technical specifications to verify the
            basic data, and request the contractors to visit the sites
            before the start of works in order to avoid costly change
            orders and contract amendments during implementation.

repnme.cdata!:
Effective use of energy, increased energy
            self-reliance and reduced environmental emissions in Belarus

abstracts.cdata!:
This Results Profile talks about the
            effective use of energy, increased energy self-reliance and
            reduced  environmental emissions in Belarus. Social
            Infrastructure Retrofitting Project, helped the government
            of Belarus to reduce the country’s energy dependency and
            increase energy efficiency. Pupils, teachers, doctors, and
            patients received improved heating and lighting services in
            745 social sector buildings in all regions of Belarus. Heat
            consumption had been reduced by 50 percent, electricity
            consumption has been reduced by 15 percent. Energy
            self-reliance had also improved as indicated by the increase
            in local fuels in the country’s energy balance

docna.cdata!:
Uso eficaz de la energía, mayor
            autosuficiencia energética y reducción de emisiones al medio
            ambiente en Belarús

display_title.display_title:

            increased energy self-reliance and reduced environmental
            emissions in Belarus : Uso eficaz de la energía, mayor
            autosuficiencia energética y reducción de emisiones al medio
            ambiente en Belarús

repnme.cdata!:
Belarus - Social Infrastructure
            Retrofitting Project (Additional Financing)

abstracts.cdata!:
This Project Paper seeks the approval of
            the Executive Directors to provide additional financing to
            Belarus for the Social Infrastructure Retrofitting Project
            (P044748). The proposed additional loan would be used to
            complete the rehabilitation of the original investment
            program for energy efficiency improvements in social sector
            buildings (schools and hospitals) across Belarus. Higher
            than estimated bid prices on the energy efficiency
            improvements due to the strong Euro and increases in wages
            in Belarus forced the implementing agencies to reduce the
            number of buildings covered in the original project.
            Additional energy efficiency retrofitting in about 140
            buildings (schools and hospitals) across Belarus shall be
            implemented, including required consultants and support to
            the project management unit (PMU). The PMU has been funded
            from the government energy efficiency budget.

docna.cdata!:
Belarus - Social Infrastructure Retrofitting
            Project (Additional Financing)
